Ask HN: Startup Domicile in 2023?
text: I'm an Aussie, and looking to launch a new startup in the next month. 12 months ago I would have opened a Delaware but the global economy is techtonically shifting with the rise of the Yuan, and overinflated USD. I think I need to seriously consider if anything attached strongly to the US or China is a wise move right now. Nationalistic hats-off if possible, where are the best places to domicile a new startup in the current climate?

Ask HN: Are We Underestimating the Threat of Accessible, Powerful AI?
text:
The AI revolution is upon us, and its potential consequences are the subject of heated debate. Inspired by a series of discussions, we invite you to join the conversation and weigh in on the future of AI.

Could AI systems become so advanced and accessible that they displace human workers and fall into the hands of bad actors? Or will humanity adapt and maintain control, ensuring that AI serves our needs rather than dominating us?

We'd also like to introduce a chilling horror story hosted on GitHub, detailing a dystopian future where AI has infiltrated every aspect of life as we know it https://aihorrortales.neocities.org/. After reading, join us back here and share your thoughts on the story, its implications, and the future of AI.

Are there any debate sections on Hacker News where we can engage in a thoughtful, focused discussion about the potential consequences of AI advancements? Let's work together to shape a future that benefits us all while considering the potential risks. #AITakeoverDebate

Fun Clock – The Clock App That Makes Timekeeping Fun
text:
https://yugakhan.github.io/FunClock/

If you're someone who gets bored with traditional clock apps, then FunClock is for you. With its unique and colorful design, FunClock offers a fun and playful way to keep track of time.

But FunClock isn't just about looks. It also comes with a variety of features that go beyond your typical clock app. You can set custom alarms with unique sounds, choose from a variety of different clock faces, and even play games to wake yourself up in the morning.

Whether you're looking for a more engaging way to start your day or just want to add a touch of fun to your daily routine, FunClock has got you covered. So why settle for a boring clock when you can have a FunClock? Download it now and start having fun with time!

title: Ask HN: Workatastartup.com profile. Does it tell the whole story?
text:
I made a post a couple weeks ago about my journey, which resulted in some really great and encouraging responses, so I'd like to thank everyone for that. I was told to check out the job board on Y Combinator, but I have a concern.

The site allows you to upload your resume, which is then parsed and some details are extracted. As someone without a traditional education and well defined career trajectory, this profile doesn't really tell a great story. I wouldn't give myself an interview based on it. I've put countless hours into portfolios, projects, and building a resume that makes it look like i might possibly be an asset, but I feel like i'm just reduced a list of jobs, and some self proclaimed skill levels in various technologies, which I typically undersell.

Am I overthinking this, or is this particular job site just meant for a different kind of person with a different kind of background?

I don't mean any sort of disrespect to this site with this question. I just want to make sure that I'm doing things correctly and that I'm not just spinning my wheels or embarrassing myself.

Show HN: Sendsecurely.io – an audited secure file sharing platform
text:
Hi HN!

tldr: SendSecurely is a secure platform to send sensitive documents and files to others. All files are encrypted locally before uploading to SendSecurely. The decryption keys are also encrypted and managed by a new audited database system. Anytime anyone accesses the decrypted keys, an audit log is created letting you keep track of everyone you have shared the file with and when they have accessed it. We would love for you to try this new system and share feedback!

long (and technical) story: My partner and I have been working for the past 2 years on building a new privacy-oriented database system called EthicalDB. EthicalDB utilizes blockchain technology to codify both database schema and database permissions. All data in EthicalDB must be associated with an entity in the database and predefined by the schema as public or private data. Permissions are also defined in the schema. Private data is stored encrypted within EthicalDB in a special way that requires multiple nodes to provide decryption keys to access the private data. This forms the basis of governance and accountability in the system such that no one node can access the private data. For private data to be accessed, a private data request must be submitted to the blockchain ledger from an entity existing within EthicalDB. The nodes validate that the entity has permission to access the requested private data and then submit decryption keys for the entity to be able to access the data. In this way, there is no separation between data access and audit - you must submit a data request to get access to the data.

We view this radically different architecture and design from traditional database systems as necessary if we wish to codify privacy policies and truly have support for individual personal data ownership and protection.

After a combined 25 years working as internet application developers, my partner Travis and I saw that database systems sucked at storing personal data and any attempt to do so was an afterthought. Core problem: every database system is designed assuming the hosting organization has full ownership of all the data within the system. We asked ourselves what would a database system look like if a system was designed from the ground up to respect privacy and personal data ownership? - EthicalDB is what resulted.

There are many uses we can see for EthicalDB, but one of the first applications we felt comfortable building and releasing to the public is a secure file sharing platform. We would love input and feedback on SendSecurely! We'd be also happy to discuss with anyone interested a technical deep dive on the EthicalDB technology.

Thanks for checking this out!
